alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Merrimack; Southern Carroll; Southern Grafton; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 05 at 10:12PM EDT until April 06 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN EXPECTED TODAY INTO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... .Cooler air filtering in from high pressure building into Maritime Canada will allow a spring storm to bring a mix of wintry precipitation, mainly in the form of freezing rain and sleet in the advisory area. While precipitation is ongoing mainly across the mountains this morning, more widespread precipitation is expected to develop this afternoon and evening. Cooling temperatures this evening will see cold rain in the foothills and interior locations turn to freezing rain. Slick travel conditions are the primary hazard with this storm, especially after sunset, lasting through Thursday morning. Temperatures are expected to rebound above freezing through Thursday morning, bringing an end to freezing precipitation. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain. Additional ice accumulations around one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine. Portions of central and northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 8 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible due to icy road conditions. Difficult travel conditions are possible due to icy road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
